name: Fragrant drawer sachet in vintage fabric filled with English lavender
description:
Fragrant sachet made of vintage linen with applique and filled with English Lavender - 1/2 a cup in each bag!!!
There are no artificial scents or other fillings used. The scent of lavender is known for its calming effect. Aromatherapists use lavender in inhalation therapy to treat headaches, nervous disorders, aches, and exhaustion. 

Sachets will make a nice gift for all ages including: teachers, bride mates, and party guest (wedding favors). Place a sachet pillows on drawers, closet, luggage, storage bins, next to your bed, etc. They are known to be a natural insect repellent.

Each one measures 4 X 3 inches/ 10 x 8 cm. approximately.

"Lavandula angustifolia is the most common type of lavender and it hails from England .It is oftentimes referred to as true lavender"

* Handmade in the USA

Some facts about LAVENDER:
* stress relief -just crush and roll them between your fingers and inhale...
* Calming effects
* Aids in sleeping
* Helps eliminate bad smells


When the fragrance seem to loose its full aroma, just crush the bag and roll it betwen your fingers... You may also add couple of drops of lavender oil on the bag itself. 
I suggest doing that at the seams so that the oil won't stain the bag

name: Fragrant sachet in lavender
description:
Lavender Bag for your home, office or car.
Placing this sachet under your pillow can also help in the quality of your sleep.

The bag is generously filled with dried fragrant lavender imported from the UK

"Lavandula angustifolia is the most common type of lavender and it hails from England .It is oftentimes referred to as true lavender"


* 100% cotton & unbleached cotton
* Approximately 3" x 4" (10cm x10cm), very spacious
* Handmade in the USA

Some facts about LAVENDER:
* stress relief -just crush and roll them between your fingers and inhale...
* Calming effects
* Aids in sleeping
* Helps eliminate bad smells

THIS PRICE IS FOR ONE BAG

When the fragrance seem to loose its full aroma, just crush the pillow and roll it betwen your fingers... You may also add couple of drops of lavender oil on the pillow itself. 
I suggest doing that at the seams so that the oil won't stain the pillow
